key_points: The world's largest container ship, EVER ACE, successfully crossed the Suez Canal on its maiden voyage.
EVER ACE was built by Samsung Heavy Industries for Evergreen Marine Corporation.
The ship is the first of a series of 12 container ships ordered by Evergreen.
EVER ACE has a carrying capacity of 23,992 TEU, surpassing the HMM Algeciras as the largest container ship.
It measures 400 meters in length, 61.53 meters in width, and weighs approximately 235,000 tons.
The Suez Canal Authority (SCA) provided navigation support to ensure the ship's safe passage.
The ship's successful transit reflects the Suez Canal's capacity to accommodate giant container ships.
EVER ACE began its maiden voyage from the Port of Taipei, Taiwan, and is headed to Rotterdam, Netherlands.
The ship is expected to reach Rotterdam on September 4.
Evergreen also owns the Ever Given, known for blocking the Suez Canal in March and causing global trade disruptions.
